pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:0.5: 22. The training rule on fewer than five mends
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the Sakyan country at Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.2: At that time a potter had invited the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.3: “If any one of you needs a almsbowl, I’ll provide it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.4: But the monks lacked a sense of moderation, and they asked for many bowls.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.5: Those who had small bowls asked for large ones,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.6: and those who had large bowls asked for small ones.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.7: The potter was so busy making bowls for the monks that he was unable to make other goods for sale.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.8: He could not make a living for himself, and his wives and children suffered.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.10: “How can the Sakyan ascetics not have any sense of moderation and ask for many bowls?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.11: This potter is so busy making bowls for them that he is unable to make other goods for sale.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.12: He is unable to make a living for himself, and his wives and children are suffering.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.13: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.14: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.15: “How can those monks not have a sense of moderation and ask for many bowls?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.16: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.17: “Is it true, monks, that some monks are acting like this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.20: “… How can those foolish men not have a sense of moderation and ask for many bowls?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.21: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.22: After criticizing them, he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.1.23: “Monks, a monk should not ask for an almsbowl. If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.1: Soon afterwards the bowl of a certain monk broke.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.2: Knowing that the Buddha had prohibited asking for a bowl and being afraid of wrongdoing, he did not ask for a new one.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.3: As a consequence he collected almsfood with his hands.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.5: “How can the Sakyan ascetics collect almsfood with their hands, just like the ascetics of other religions?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.6: The monks heard the complaints of those people
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.8: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.2.9: “Monks, I allow you to ask for a new almsbowl if your bowl has been lost or is broken.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.2: Once again that potter was so busy making bowls for the monks that he was unable to make other goods for sale.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.3: He could not make a living for himself, and his wives and children suffered.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np22:1.3.4: And people complained and criticized them as before.
